title: (x) celebrating - script with fancy C - Polonaise {Jim}
content:
I am having a hard time finding this font, the C is cut off but is ornate

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015181852im_/http:/typophile.com/files/script_3626.gif)
author: vector

comments.content:
… which is a rip-off of [Phil Martin](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015181852/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Phil%20Martin)’s [Polonaise](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015181852/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/polonaise/?testdrive=dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D52%26w%3D720%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DCelebrating%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dfit%252Cot.liga%26seed%3D21).  
This has been pointed out several times in the comments on Chopin Script, but Dafont obviously decided to ignore this information.
The stupid rip-off Chopin Script does not even have the required CE glyphs!
